伯.definition: father's elder brother; senior; paternal elder uncle; eldest of brothers; respectful form of address; Count, third of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]

伯仲叔季.definition: (idiom) eldest, second, third and youngest of brothers; order of seniority among brothers

伯傑.definition: (name) Berger; Samuel Berger, former US National Security Advisor under President Carter

伯南克.definition: Bernanke (name); Ben Shalom Bernanke (1953-), US economist, Chairman of the Federal Reserve 2006-2014

伯叔祖母.definition: father's father's brother's wife; great aunt

伯恩.definition: Bern or Berne, capital of Switzerland (Tw)

伯恩斯.definition: Burns (name); Nicholas Burns (1956-), US ambassador to China 2022-

伯拉第斯拉瓦.pinyin: bó lā dì sī lā wǎ

伯樂.definition: Bole (a man who lived during Spring and Autumn Period, reputed to be able to spot a good horse); a person who is good at spotting talent

伯母.definition: wife of father's elder brother; aunt; (polite form of address for a woman who is about the age of one's mother); CL:個|个[ge4]

伯父.definition: father's elder brother; term of respect for older man; CL:個|个[ge4]

伯納斯·李.definition: Sir Tim Berners-Lee (1955-), British computer scientist and co-creator of the World Wide Web

伯賽大.definition: Bethsaida, settlement on the shore of the Sea of Galilee mentioned in the New Testament

伯邑考.definition: Bo Yikao, eldest son of King Wen of Zhou 周文王[Zhou1 Wen2 wang2] and the elder brother of King Wu 周武王[Zhou1 Wu3 wang2] who was the founder of the Zhou Dynasty 周朝[Zhou1 chao2] of ancient China

伯里克利.definition: Pericles (c. 495-429 BC), Athenian strategist and politician before and at the start of the Peloponnesian war

伯顏.definition: Bayan (name); Bayan of the Baarin (1236-1295), Mongol Yuan general under Khubilai Khan, victorious over the Southern Song 1235-1239; Bayan of the Merkid (-1340), Yuan dynasty general and politician
